statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description:
Gerald Wallace had 21 points and eight
rebounds as the Sacramento Kings extended their winning streak
against the Houston Rockets to nine games with a 103-84 victory
Sunday night.

related.description:
The injury-plagued Sacramento Kings
signed guard Jim Jackson on Sunday and put forward Hedo Turkoglu on
the injured list with a sprained wrist.
related.linkText: Short-handed Kings sign Jim Jackson, put Turkoglu on IL
related.title: Guard Jackson joins ninth team in 11 seasons
related.headline: Guard Jackson joins ninth team in 11 seasons

article.headline: Kings defeat Rockets for ninth straight time
article.linkText: Kings remain unbeaten at home with rout of Rockets
article.story:
SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) -- Even though Yao Ming gives the Houston Rockets a much bigger presence in the middle, they still have no answer for the Sacramento Kings.
Wallace

Gerald Wallace had a career-high 21 points and eight rebounds as the Kings extended their winning streak against Houston to nine games with a 103-84 victory Sunday night. It was Sacramento's first look at the heralded 7-foot-6 rookie center from China. Vlade Divac and Chris Webber took turns challenging Yao through the first three quarters. It was an education for Yao, who scored all eight of his points in the first quarter. Yao added five rebounds and two blocks in 23 minutes. "He's a rookie, you just go at him,'' said Webber, who scored 16 of his 19 points in the first half. "You try to attack him like anyone else. He's talented, but I don't care who you are, you have to get adapted to this league.'' Despite the big first quarter, Yao couldn't prevent the Kings from taking a 30-19 lead. "This is definitely the toughest team I've played against,'' Yao said through a translator. "They play five players as one. The only thing I can do is my best when they came at me.'' The athletic Wallace made 10 of 11 shots and had an impressive third-quarter dunk that Yao did not challenge, even though he was near the basket. "I had a couple of bets if I dunked on him,'' Wallace said. "Vlade said he was holding him off when I had the dunk. Of course, Vlade was one of the people I bet. He said it didn't count.'' Bobby Jackson again filled in admirably for injured Kings point guard Mike Bibby, who was scheduled to have his right foot examined Monday. Jackson scored 20 points for the Kings, who improved to 9-0 at home this season. Sacramento has won eight of nine overall. Jackson sparked a big third quarter as Sacramento outscored the Rockets 32-20 and stretched the lead to 81-58. He made two 3-pointers and had 12 points in the period. "We just played bad and they came out hot in the third quarter,'' Houston forward Maurice Taylor said. "When they are that hot, you have to make at least a few shots.'' Steve Francis scored 22 points for Houston, which had its two-game winning streak snapped and has lost 12 of 13 to the Kings. Moochie Norris had 13 points, and Taylor added 11. Doug Christie scored 14 points and grabbed seven rebounds for the Kings. Divac added 11 points and five assists. "I'm most pleased with our consistency the last two games,'' Kings coach Rick Adelman said. "We played a very solid game. I think we can win with the guys we have right now.'' Game notes
Webber made a sweeping layup late in the first quarter for his 12,000th NBA point. ... Rockets forward Glen Rice sat out with a sore back. ... Jim Jackson, who signed with the injury-plagued Kings earlier in the day, entered in the first quarter. He finished with four points. ... Houston had 21 turnovers.
